result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Requesting a new date in November.

Standard Conditions
Additional Conditions: 
No contact directly or indirectly with the party/parties named in the bail bond, no contact at their residence/property. 
Not to consume alcoholic beverages, illegal drugs or possess drug paraphernalia. 
Not possess controlled substances except for those medications specifically prescribed for him/her by a health care professional. 
Not to possess needles/syringes except with a valid prescription. 
Not to be on the premises of any tavern or business whose sole purpose is the sale of alcoholic beverages.

1:50 PM Defendant Charles Henry Eckermann appeared by phone, in custody.  Attorney Claudia T. Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Cupino on behalf of deft for today only.
Deft advised of rights, rcvd criminal complaint / reading waived, NG pleas entered and case will go to Br3 per Atty Cupino and local court rule. Held on a cash bond in the Br3 case. Signature bond set in this case and to be signed by end of next week.
